summary: An urgent email sent on August 12, 2019, from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the DOJ OIG and FBI, requesting an immediate call regarding the Epstein case. The email indicates a time-sensitive coordination need among law enforcement agencies.

events.title: Urgent Coordination Call Request
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York sends an urgent email to the DOJ OIG and FBI, requesting an immediate call regarding the Epstein case.

keyFacts: An urgent email was sent on August 12, 2019, regarding the Epstein case.
The email originated from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The recipients included the DOJ Office of the Inspector General and the FBI.
The email requested an immediate call, indicating time-sensitive coordination was needed.
The email was sent late at night (02:39 UTC), underscoring its urgency.
